algorithm_technique: Iterate through pairs, count product occurrences using a hash map.
problem_summary_simple: Find the number of quadruplets (a, b, c, d) from an array where a*b = c*d and all elements are distinct.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a hash map (Counter) to store frequencies of products of pairs (nums[i]*nums[j]). Counts tuples by summing existing counts for each new product found.
key_insights: The core idea is to find pairs with the same product.
A hash map is efficient for storing and retrieving product frequencies.
Each pair (a, b) with product P can form 8 tuples with other pairs (c, d) that also have product P.
